title: Applications called for re-scrutiny of 2024 O/L results
byline: The Ministry of Education has announced that applications for the re-scrutiny of the results of the 2024 G.C.E. Ordinary Level Examination will be accepted from today (July 14) until July 28.

title: Ex-Minister Duminda Dissanayake granted bail under strict conditions
byline: Former Minister Duminda Dissanayake, who had been arrested and remanded in connection with the recent discovery of a gold-plated T-56 firearm at an apartment complex in Havelock Town, Colombo, has been granted bail under strict bail conditions, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Trump says US will send Patriot missiles to Ukraine
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Sunday he will send Patriot air defense missiles to Ukraine, saying they are necessary to defend the country because Russian President Vladimir Putin "talks nice but then he bombs everybody in the evening."

title: CBSL to launch Anti-Pyramid National Awareness Week starting today
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) is scheduled to launch the ‘Anti-Pyramid National Awareness Week’ starting today (14).

title: UNDP to support govt’s efforts in building effective public service
byline: Azusa Kubota, the Resident Representative of the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP), affirmed that the UNDP will support the Sri Lankan government’s ongoing initiatives to build an efficient and accountable public service.

title: Cambodia’s Khmer Rouge torture sites added to UNESCO heritage list
byline: Three locations used by Cambodia’s brutal Khmer Rouge regime as torture and execution sites 50 years ago have been added by UNESCO to its World Heritage List.

title: Bitcoin tops $120,000 for the first time
byline: Bitcoin crossed the $120,000 level for the first time on Monday, marking a major milestone for the world’s largest cryptocurrency as investors bet on long-sought policy wins for the industry this week.

title: Every student will have access to jobs or higher education under new reforms – PM
byline: Minister of Education, Higher Education, and Vocational Education, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, emphasized that the selection of underprivileged schools for development should be made with the approval of the District Development Committee and not based on favoritism.

title: Accomplice of organized criminal arrested with ‘Ice’ haul and revolver
byline: A 31-year-old female suspect has been arrested at Ibbagawatta junction in the Modara area while in possession of 20 grams of ‘Ice’ (crystal methamphetamine).

title: London Southend Airport to remain closed after ‘fireball’ crash
byline: Essex Police said they were alerted shortly before 4pm on Sunday to “reports of a collision involving one 12-metre plane” at the airport, calling it a “serious incident” although there has been no confirmation of the number of casualties.

title: Trump demands more concessions as EU holds off on US tariff countermeasures
byline: The European Union said on Sunday it would extend its suspension of countermeasures to U.S. tariffs until early August and continue to press for a negotiated settlement as U.S. President Donald Trump’s administration demanded more concessions from trading partners.

title: Several spells of showers expected today
byline: Showers will occur at times in the Western and Sabaragamuwa provinces and in Nuwara-Eliya, Kandy, Galle and Matara districts, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: Four injured after buses collide in Nawinna
byline: At least four persons have been injured and hospitalised following an accident involving two private buses that occurred in the Nawinna area of Maharagama at around 6.00 a.m. this morning (14).

title: TN Chief Minister urges Jaishankar to secure release of fishermen from Sri Lankan custody
byline: Tamil Nadu Chief minister M K Stalin has urged the Union government to take urgent diplomatic steps to secure the release of seven Rameswaram fishermen apprehended by the Sri Lankan navy in the early hours of Sunday.

title: Nigeria’s ex-president Buhari, twice leader of Africa’s most populous nation, dies at 82
byline: Former Nigerian President Muhammadu Buhari, who led the country twice as a military head of state and a democratic president, has died aged 82, his press secretary said Sunday.

title: Plane crashes at London Southend Airport
byline: An aircraft has crashed at London Southend Airport, police have confirmed.

title: 10 including 6 children fetching water killed in Israeli strike in Gaza
byline: Ten people, including six children, have been killed in an Israeli air strike while waiting to fill water containers in central Gaza on Sunday, emergency service officials say.

title: Parents’ support key to make education reforms a success: PM Harini
byline: The support of not only teachers, but also the administrative sector and parents, is vital for the successful implementation of proposed education reforms, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has stated.

title: Sri Lanka to seek further tariff cut from US before deadline
byline: The Chairman of the Export Development Board (EDB), Mangala Wijesinghe, stated that discussions will be held with the United States before August 01, in an effort to obtain further relief from the 30% reciprocal tariffs imposed on goods exported from Sri Lanka.

title: Red warning issued for strong winds and rough seas
byline: A ‘Red’ warning has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for strong winds and rough seas for areas extending from Galle to Pottuvil via Matara and Hambantota.

title: ‘Superman’ smashes box office expectations, soaring towards $130 million opening
byline: It’s not a bird or a plane — it’s the latest “Superman” movie soaring towards the top of the box office.

title: xAI issues lengthy apology for violent and antisemitic Grok social media posts
byline: Elon Musk’s artificial intelligence company xAI issued a lengthy apology Saturday for a series of violent and antisemitic posts from its Grok chatbot this week, blaming a system update.

title: Two killed in bus-motorcycle collision
byline: Two people have died in a road accident involving a private bus and a motorcycle that occurred today (July 13) on the Mirigama–Pasyala main road in the Mallahawa area.

title: Piumi Hansamali’s son arrested over assault incident in Rajagiriya
byline: The son of actress Piumi Hansamali has been arrested by the Welikada Police in connection with an assault on an individual in Kalapaluwawa, Rajagiriya.

title: Sri Sobitha Nahimigama Housing Project vested with public
byline: The official handover of the Sri Sobitha Nahimigama housing project to its beneficiaries has taken place at the Oyamadua, Elpathagama in the Anuradhapura District, with the participation of Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, the Office of the Prime Minister stated.

title: Sri Lankan engineer’s ‘Smart Drain’ innovation earns global recognition at WIPO Awards 2025
byline: Sri Lankan engineer Dr. Nadeesha Chandrasena has won a 2025 WIPO Global Award in the environment category for her innovative stormwater management solution, the ‘Smart Drain’.

title: Piumi Hansamali’s son granted bail
byline: The son of actress Piumi Hansamali has been granted bail after being produced before the Colombo Chief Magistrate’s Court (No. 07) today (13).

title: Two suspects remanded over illegal motorcycles and cannabis plants seized at Hambantota Bird Park
byline: The two suspects who were arrested yesterday (13) for storing illegally imported high-capacity motorcycles valued at Rs. 250 million at the Bird Park warehouse in Hambantota, have been remanded until July 25 by the Hambantota Magistrate’s Court.

title: Another suspect linked to murder of ‘Army Upul’ arrested
byline: An individual who allegedly assisted in the shooting and killing of ‘Army Upul’ in Batuwatta, Ragama has been arrested by the Kelaniya Division Crime Investigation Unit.

title: US online spending surges as steep discounts boost sales
byline: Online spending soared USD 24.1 billion across U.S. retailers during the stretch from July 8 to 11 – dubbed “Black Friday in Summer”, outpacing Adobe Analytics’ prior forecast, as eager shoppers rushed to snap up deep discounts on back-to-school essentials.

title: Heatwave continues across UK
byline: Hot weather will continue across the UK on Sunday with possible highs of 31C as the country moves past the peak of its third heatwave this year.

title: North Korea reaffirms support for Russia’s war in Ukraine
byline: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un offered Moscow his “unconditional support” on the war in Ukraine, according to Pyongyang state media reports.

title: Kerala cannabis valued over Rs. 15 mn seized in Jaffna
byline: A stock of 38kg and 700g of Kerala cannabis has been seized by the Sri Lanka Navy during a search operation conducted off the Eluvaitivu Island in Jaffna.

title: Mother of ‘Ishara Sewwandi’ dies in prison
byline: The mother of ‘Ishara Sewwandi’, the fugitive female suspect wanted in connection with the murder of underworld figure Sanjeewa Kumara Samararatne, alias ‘Ganemulla Sanjeewa,’ has reportedly died while in custody at the Welikada Prison.

title: ‘Exam-based education system is flawed and needs change’: PM Harini
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the current perspective on education is extremely narrow, and that the practice of evaluating education solely based on exam results is a flawed approach that needs to change.

title: Massive fire erupts on goods train carrying diesel in Tamil Nadu
byline: A major fire broke out on four wagons of a goods train carrying diesel near the Tiruvallur railway station around 5:30 am this morning triggering panic in the surrounding areas. Visuals from the scene showed towering flames and thick plumes of black smoke billowing from the affected wagons.

title: CBSL’s Anti-Pyramid National Awareness Week from tomorrow
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) will launch the ‘Anti-Pyramid National Awareness Week’ from tomorrow (14).

title: No new recruitments at CPC – Managing Director
byline: The Managing Director of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) and Ceylon Petroleum Storage Terminals Limited (CPSTL), Dr. Mayura Netthikumarage, has announced that there will be no new recruitments at the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC).

title: Rajitha Senaratne files anticipatory bail application
byline: Former Minister Rajitha Senaratne has filed an anticipatory bail application before the Colombo Magistrate’s Court, seeking release on bail in the event of his arrest by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC).

title: Info on 26 Sri Lankans arrested in Malaysia for various offences received by Police
byline: Sri Lankan authorities have been officially informed about 26 Sri Lankans who have been arrested in Malaysia for various offences, according to Police Spokesperson Assistant Superintendent of Police (ASP) F.U. Wootler.

title: Air India pilot’s medical records being examined ‘over mental health fears’
byline: The medical records of one of the pilots of the doomed Air India plane are being examined after it has been claimed he suffered from poor mental health.

title: 68 shootings reported across Sri Lanka so far in 2025
byline: A total of 68 shooting incidents have been reported across the island in the past seven months of this year, Sri Lanka Police said.

title: Thailand mulls zero duty for more US goods to win tariff deal
byline: Thailand is weighing allowing zero-duty market access for more US goods to help persuade the Trump administration to lower a threatened 36% tariff on its exports.

title: Over 900kg of heroin seized in island wide anti-narcotics operations: Police
byline: A total of 922 kilograms of heroin have been seized during joint operations conducted by Sri Lanka Police and Tri-forces across the island over the past seven months of this year.

title: ‘Red’ warning issued for strong winds and rough seas
byline: A ‘Red’ warning has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for strong winds and rough seas for areas extending from Chilaw to Mannar via Puttalam and from Galle to Pottuvil via Hambantota.

title: Petition seeking injunction on Seethawaka PS chairman election dismissed
byline: The Court of Appeal has dismissed a petition seeking an injunction to prevent Western Province Local Government Commissioner Sarangika Jayasundara from conducting a secret ballot to elect the Chairman and Vice Chairman of the Seethawaka Pradeshiya Sabha.

title: 181 Indian fishermen, 24 boats taken into custody for poaching in 2025
byline: A total of 181 Indian fishermen have been arrested by the Sri Lanka Navy (SLN) in 2025 for poaching in Sri Lankan waters.

title: Legendary Indian actress Saroja Devi passes away
byline: Veteran South Indian Actor B Saroja Devi died here on Monday, film industry sources said.

title: NPP now following Ranil’s path after reversing its stance on taxes - Dilith
byline: The present government-led by the National People’s Power (NPP) has changed its stance on taxes and is now following the path taken by former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, leader of the Sarvajana Balaya Alliance Parliamentarian Dilith Jayaweera stated.

title: 6.7-magnitude earthquake strikes Indonesia’s Tanimbar Islands Region
byline: An earthquake of magnitude 6.7 struck off the coast of Indonesia’s Tanimbar Islands region on Monday, the country’s geophysics agency said, adding there was no tsunami potential.

title: Injured tusker ‘Bhathiya’ continues to receive treatment from team of experts
byline: Treatment for the critically injured wild tusker ‘Bhathiya’ is continuing with the involvement of several experts.

title: The biggest piece of Mars on Earth is going up for auction in New York
byline: 54-pound (25-kilogram) rock. Estimated auction price: $2 million to $4 million. Why so expensive? It’s the largest piece of Mars ever found on Earth.

title: Ex-DMT Assistant Commissioner and two others granted bail
byline: A former Assistant Commissioner of the Department of Motor Traffic and two other officials who were arrested by the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) and subsequently remanded by court have been granted bail, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Ex-State Minister Prasanna Ranaweera further remanded
byline: Former State Minister Prasanna Ranaweera has been remanded until July 28 by the Mahara Magistrate’s Court, Ada Derana reporter said.

title: Programme to provide allowance to street children and those under institutional care to commence tomorrow
byline: The programme to grant a monthly allowance of Rs. 5,000 to children held in detention homes, child development centers or with a guardian and street children will commence tomorrow, Minister of Women and Child Affairs Saroja Savithri Paulraj stated.

title: GovPay can be used to pay all traffic spot fines from Sept - ICTA
byline: Measures will be taken to facilitate the payment of spot fines issued by Police for traffic violations through the use of GovPay application from September, Harsha Purasinghe, a board member of the Information and Communication Technology Agency stated.

title: Public officials to face fines for failure to submit asset declarations – CIABOC
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) has announced that fines will be imposed on public officials who fail to submit their assets and liabilities declarations after today (14 July).

title: COPE recommends Govt to take over SLIIT citing unlawful privatization
byline: The Committee on Public Enterprises (COPE) recently recommended that legal steps be taken to take over the Sri Lanka Institute of Information Technology (SLIIT), ...

title: CID questions MP Sujeewa Senasinghe for three hours
byline: Member of Parliament Sujeewa Senasinghe has appeared before the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) this morning (14) to provide a statement regarding an incident involving an illegally assembled vehicle.

title: Joint Postal Trade Union Front to withdraw from overtime duties
byline: The Joint Postal Trade Union Front has announced that it will commence a strike action by withdrawing from all overtime duties at post offices and administrative offices across the island.

title: ASPI records new all-time high
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed at an all-time high after gaining over 297 points today.

title: Mirigama shooting victim succumbs to injuries
byline: An individual has sustained injuries in a shooting incident in Mirigama, police said.

title: First Indian astronaut to go to ISS is on his way back
byline: Astronaut Shubhanshu Shukla, who created history by becoming the first Indian ever to set foot on the International Space Station (ISS), is on his way back.

title: Customs has never released red-labeled containers before: SLPP lawyers
byline: Since the inception of Sri Lanka Customs in 1805, containers marked with red labels have never been released, according to the Lawyers’ Association of the Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna.

title: Energy Ministry reviews Sri Lanka’s preparedness for nuclear energy
byline: A special program to review Sri Lanka’s preparedness for nuclear energy, which can be described as a significant step in the field of nuclear power in Sri Lanka, has been launched under the leadership of the Minister of Energy, Engineer (Eng.) Kumara Jayakody.

title: Appointment to be granted to 304 Ayurvedic doctors promptly
byline: Steps will be taken to promptly grant appointments to 304 Ayurvedic doctors, as approval for these appointments has already been granted, Minister of Health and Mass Media, Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa.

title: Sri Lanka and Saudi Fund sign agreements to restructure SAR 517 mn
byline: The Government of Sri Lanka (GoSL) has signed Bilateral Amendatory Loan Agreements with the Saudi Fund for Development (SFD), marking a significant milestone in the country’s ongoing External Debt Restructuring Process, the Ministry of Finance, Planning, and Economic Development stated.

title: Trump to slam Russia with 100% tariffs if no deal is made on Ukraine in 50 days
byline: US President Donald Trump said on Monday he has struck a deal with NATO to purchase the weapons that will be delivered to Ukraine, as he met NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte in Washington.
